cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 mi ESE of Key West, Florida and 165 mi E of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move WNW across or just north of Cuba, then turn NW toward the Florida Keys Saturday and the northeast Gulf of Mexico, with landfall likely along the Florida Big-Bend/Panhandle Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / eastern Panhandle coast (near Apalachicola – St. Marks)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only for the Florida Keys, portions of southwest Florida, and parts of central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba north coast, Florida Keys, Florida Peninsula and Big Bend, then the northern Gulf Coast and ultimately the Southeast interior
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤3%) chance of 34-kt gusts late in the 5-day window; operationally negligible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the New Jersey coast from Fred
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain mid-week, mainly nuisance impact
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river rises or localized ponding possible if remnants pass nearby
